Description: See description of order_bq_1_ans
Numerical encoding of the reader domain; 0=biology, 1=physics.
Fixation: 1 if the word was fixated, otherwise 0 (FPF or RR).
Numerical value of text_domain; 0=biology, 1=physics.
Option 3 for text question 1.
The index of the uncorrected fixation.
Option 1 for text question 1.
The number of occurrences of an annotated type in corpus. An annotated type is a unique combination of a type, its part-of-speech tag and its lemma.
The accuracy of background question 1. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
Missing value description: For participant 1 (p0), 31 (p0, b1, b5), 32 (p0), 61 (p1), 62 (b0, b1, b3, b5, 04) and 90 (b3) the accuracies for certain trials are missing due to hardware problems (missing measurements).

Description: The stimulus text.
Re-reading: 1 if the word was fixated after the first-pass reading, otherwise 0 (sign(RRT)).
Option 3 for background question 3.
First-pass regression: 1 if a regression was initiated in the first-pass reading of the word, otherwise 0 (sign(RPD exc)).
The length of the type of a word in characters. See the description of word_length for a definition of how characters are counted.
Each participant reads all 12 texts, the order of which follows their trial number. If text b0 has trial number 2 for participant 5, this participant read text b0 as the second text.
The area of expertise of the reader. All readers are students whose major is either physics or biology.
Option 3 for background question 2.
Total-fixation time: sum of all fixations on a word (FPRT+RRT).
Part-of-speech tag as defined by the dlexDB query.
Total count of incoming regressions: total number of regressive saccades landing on this word.
The index of a sentence in the respective text. Indexing starts at 1.
The header of the respective stimulus text.
Incoming saccade length: length of the saccade that leads to first fixation on a word in number of words; positive sign if the saccade is a progressive one, negative sign if it is a regression.
Option 2 for text question 3.

First-reading time: sum of the duration of all fixations from first fixating the word (independent if the first fixation occurs in first-pass reading) until leaving the word for the first time (equals FPRT in case the word was fixated in the first-pass).
Option 4 for text question 1.
The domain of the stimulus text.

Specifies the version of the items. In each version, the order of the stimuli and the order of the answer options for each question differ. The specifics of each version can be found in the items.tsv.
Numerical value of expert_status; 0=beginner, 1=expert.
Whether or not the word is part of a phrase in parentheses.
The accuracy of background question 2. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
Missing value description: For participant 1 (p0), 31 (p0, b1, b5), 32 (p0), 61 (p1), 62 (b0, b1, b3, b5, 04) and 90 (b3) the accuracies for certain trials are missing due to hardware problems (missing measurements).

Description: The orthographical representation of a word as found in the corpus; this data is case sensitive, i.e. there is a distinction between name and Name.
The region of interest specified as character index in the text (see char_index_in_text). Defines which character has been fixated.
Option 3 for background question 1.
The unique identifier given to each reader. Reader IDs start at 0.

The index of the correct answer for text question 3. Specified as option number of the questions in that file. For example: 2 means that the answer that is specified in the column "tq_3_option2" is the correct answer to this question.
Whether or not the word is the beginning of a new sentence.
Index of a character in the text. Indexing starts at 1.
Option 2 for text question 1.
The index of the word in the sentence. Indexing starts at 1.
Words as they appear in the stimuli texts. Words are split at white-space.
Option 4 for background question 3.

Exclusive regression-path duration: Sum of all fixation durations after initiating a first-pass regression from a word until fixating a word to the right of this word, without counting fixations on the word itself (RPD_inc-RBRT).
Option 2 for text question 2.
Option 1 for text question 2.
The y-coordinate in pixels of the top left corner of the aoi rectangle.
Part-of-speech tags according to the STTS-tagset. See stimuli/ANNOTATION.MD for more information.
Word length is defined in number of characters including symbols like hyphens but without sentence punctuation at the end (i.e., z.B. = 4 characters; DNA-Kette =9 characters; eats.=4 characters).
The accuracy of text question 1. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
Missing value description: For participant 1 (p0), 31 (p0, b1, b5), 32 (p0), 61 (p1), 62 (b0, b1, b3, b5, 04) and 90 (b3) the accuracies for certain trials are missing due to hardware problems (missing measurements).

Description: Option 1 for background question 2.
The duration of the fixation in milliseconds.
The duration of the saccade that follows a fixation in milliseconds.

Specifies the limits of each word in character indices. Format: [word_start],[word_end]. For example: 3,7 means a word starts at character index 3 in the text and ends at character index 7. The properties of the character indices are specified in char_index_in_text.
Option 1 for background question 3.
1 if the word is a technical term that is not generally understandable. E.g.: ""Agarose"".
The duration of a saccade that preceeds a fixation in milliseconds.
Option 2 for background question 3.
Whether or not the word contains a symbol. E.g.: β-D-Glucose
Text question 1.
Reader's expert status. Readers are considered experts if they are either MSc or PhD students. 1st semester BSc students are considered beginners.
Option 4 for background question 2.
The mean accuracy of all background questions for one text read by one reader.

The conditional probability of the bigram, given the occurrence of its first component. In other words, how likely it is for the second component to follow directly after the first. Here, this measure is computed on the basis of the annotated type information.
Numerical value of gender; 0=male, 1=female.
Background question 3.
Whether or not the entire word is an abbreviation.
First-pass fixation: 1 if the word was fixated in the first-pass, otherwise 0.
Whether or not the word is part of an expression in quotes.
First-fixation duration: duration of the first fixation on a word if this word is fixated in first-pass reading, otherwise 0.
First-pass reading time: sum of the durations of all first-pass fixations on a word (0 if the word was skipped in the first-pass).
See description of order_bq_1_ans
See description of order_bq_1_ans
Whether or not the word is the beginning of a clause.
The texts were presented on the screen in multiple lines. Specifies the line of the respective row; indexing starts at 1.
Text question 2.
If a word is preceded by a punctuation mark, the STTS-PoS-tag of the punctuation mark is added here.
The accuracy of text question 3. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
Missing value description: For participant 1 (p0), 31 (p0, b1, b5), 32 (p0), 61 (p1), 62 (b0, b1, b3, b5, 04) and 90 (b3) the accuracies for certain trials are missing due to hardware problems (missing measurements).

Description: Option 1 for text question 3.
The y-coordinate in pixels of the bottom right corner of the aoi rectangle.
Background question 2.
See description of order_bq_1_ans

The index of the correct answer for background question 1. Specified as option number of the questions in that file. For example: 2 means that the answer that is specified in the column "tq_3_option2" is the correct answer to this question.
The mean accuracy of all text questions for one text read by one reader.

The conditional probability of the trigram, given the occurrence of its initial bigram. In other words, how likely it is for the third component to follow directly after the initial pair. Here, this measure is computed on the basis of the annotated type information.

The index of the correct answer for background question 3. Specified as option number of the questions in that file. For example: 2 means that the answer that is specified in the column "tq_3_option2" is the correct answer to this question.
See description of order_bq_1_ans

The index of the correct answer for text question 1. Specified as option number of the questions in that file. For example: 2 means that the answer that is specified in the column "tq_3_option2" is the correct answer to this question.
Unique identifier given to each stimulus text.

Inclusive regression-path duration: Sum of all fixation durations starting from the first first-pass fixation on a word until fixation on a word to the right of this word (including all regressive fixations on previous words), 0 if the word was not fixated in the first-pass (RPD_exc+RBRT).
Whether or not a participant consumed alcohol within 24 hours before the experiment start.
The x-coordinate in pixels of the bottom right corner of the aoi rectangle.
The order in which the answers for background question 1 were presented.
Option 4 for text question 2.
Character as text.

The index of the correct answer for background question 2. Specified as option number of the questions in that file. For example: 2 means that the answer that is specified in the column "tq_3_option2" is the correct answer to this question.
The combination of the readers' major (reader_domain) and their expertise (expert_status).
The x-coordinate in pixels of the top left corner of the aoi rectangle.
The index of the word in the text. Indexing starts at 1.
Background question 1.
Reader's gender.
The hours of sleep of the participant before the experiment.

The index of the correct answer for text question 2. Specified as option number of the questions in that file. For example: 2 means that the answer that is specified in the column "tq_3_option2" is the correct answer to this question.
The accuracy of background question 3. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
Missing value description: For participant 1 (p0), 31 (p0, b1, b5), 32 (p0), 61 (p1), 62 (b0, b1, b3, b5, 04) and 90 (b3) the accuracies for certain trials are missing due to hardware problems (missing measurements).

Description: Whether or not the word contains an abbreviation. 0 for words that are only an abbreviation. See is_abbreviation. E.g. 1 for DNA-Fragment, 0 for DNA.
Option 4 for text question 3.
Whether or not the fixation has been adjusted manually.
Index of a character in the line. Indexing starts at 1.
Reader's age.
Option 2 for background question 2.
Whether or not reader is wearing glasses.
Numerical value of domain_expert_status; 0=biology-beginner, 1=biology-expert, 2=physics-beginner, 3=physics-expert.
Option 3 for text question 3.
Re-reading time: sum of the durations of all fixations on a word that do not belong to the first-pass (TFT-FPRT).
Right-bounded reading time: Sum of all fixation durations on a word until a word to the right of this word is fixated (RPD_inc-RDP_exc).
Landing position: position of the first saccade on the word expressed by ordinal position of the fixated character.
Total count of outgoing regressions: total number of regressive saccades initiated from this word.
Option 3 for text question 2.
The index of the fixation in temporal order.
The accuracy of text question 2. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
Missing value description: For participant 1 (p0), 31 (p0, b1, b5), 32 (p0), 61 (p1), 62 (b0, b1, b3, b5, 04) and 90 (b3) the accuracies for certain trials are missing due to hardware problems (missing measurements).

Description: Option 4 for background question 1.
Option 1 for background question 1.
If a word is followed by a punctuation mark, the STTS-PoS-tag of the punctuation mark is added here.

Outgoing saccade length: length of the first saccade that leaves the word in number of words; positive sign if the saccade is a progressive one, negative sign if it is a regression; 0 if the word is never fixated.
Reader's handedness.
Option 2 for background question 1.

Single-fixation duration: duration of the only first-pass fixation on a word, 0 if the word was skipped or more than one fixation occurred in the first-pass (equals FFD in case of a single first-pass fixation).
Text question 3.

Whether or not the word contains a hyphen. E.g. 1 for DNA-Fragment (*not* words that have tag TRUNC (compositional first element, e.g. in "Sekundär- und Tertiärstrukturen", "Sekundär-" does not count as having a hyphen.)).
First duration: duration of the first fixation on a word (identical to FFD if not skipped in the first-pass).
The shape of the area of interest. In this corpus, all aois are rectangles around the characters.
1 if the word is a technical term that is generally understandable. E.g.: "elektrisch"
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (GerPT2).
Numerical value of text_id; 0=b0, 1=b1, 2=b2, 3=b3, 4=b4, 5=b5, 6=p0, 7=p1, 8=p2, 9=p3, 10=p4, 11=p5
The dependency tree of the sentence in the text.
The sentence in the text.
The x-coordinate of the fixation.
The y-coordinate of the fixation.
The total fixation count on the word.
The word as it appears in the text, including punctuation.
Whether or not the word is the end of a clause.
Whether or not the word is the end of a sentence.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (GerPT2-base) with the sentence as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (GerPT2-large) with the sentence as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (GerPT2-base) with the text as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (GerPT2-large) with the text as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (LeoLM-7b) with the sentence as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (LeoLM-7b) with the text as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (LeoLM-13b) with the sentence as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (LeoLM-13b) with the text as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (BERT-large) with the sentence as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (BERT-large) with the text as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (BERT-base) with the sentence as context.
Surprisal value extracted from a language model (BERT-base) with the text as context.
